messages.content:
yarn run v1.22.19
warning ../../../package.json: No license field
$ cd frontend && yarn start
warning package.json: No license field
warning ../../../../package.json: No license field
$ vite --open
/bin/sh: vite: command not found
error Command failed with exit code 127.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
error Command failed with exit code 127.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.

The error message "vite: command not found" indicates that Vite, a development tool and build system, is not installed or accessible in your project.

Here's how you can fix this:

1. **Install Vite globally:** Vite can be installed globally on your machine by running the command `npm install -g create-vite`. This will make Vite accessible from any location on your machine. You might need administrator permissions to install global packages depending on your setup.

2. **Install Vite as a devDependency in your project:** To ensure that your project has access to Vite, you can install it as a devDependency. Navigate to your project directory in the terminal, and then run `yarn add vite --dev`. This will install Vite and add it to the `devDependencies` section of your project's `package.json` file. 

3. **Check your PATH variable:** If you have Vite installed but it's not accessible, it might be because the location of your global npm packages is not included in your PATH environment variable. You can check your PATH with `echo $PATH` on Unix-like systems or `echo %PATH%` on Windows, and check your global npm packages location with `npm config get prefix`.

Remember, when installing packages locally for your project, you should be in the correct directory (the root directory of your project where your `package.json` is located). 

If you're still having trouble, you might need to delete your `node_modules` folder and your `yarn.lock` file and then run `yarn install` again to ensure all packages are installed correctly.

found 0 vulnerabilities

error when starting dev server:
Error [ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND]: Cannot find package 'tailwindcss' imported from /Users/bilalghalib/Projects/Github/anything-llm/frontend/vite.config.js.timestamp-1686231593543-a2907a03d4cf5.mjs
    at new NodeError (node:internal/errors:399:5)
    at packageResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:889:9)
    at moduleResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:938:20)
    at defaultResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:1153:11)
    at nextResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:163:28)
    at ESMLoader.resolve (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:838:30)
    at ESMLoader.getModuleJob (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:424:18)
    at ModuleWrap.<anonymous> (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:77:40)
    at link (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:76:36)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.

The error message "Cannot find package 'tailwindcss' imported from /Users/bilalghalib/Projects/Github/anything-llm/frontend/vite.config.js" is indicating that the `tailwindcss` package is not installed or not accessible in your project.

Here's how you can fix this:

1. **Navigate to your project's directory.** Before installing packages, ensure that you're in the correct directory. It should be the root directory of your project, where your `package.json` file is located.

2. **Install Tailwind CSS.** Once you're in the correct directory, run the command `yarn add tailwindcss`. This will add Tailwind CSS to the `dependencies` or `devDependencies` section of your `package.json` file, depending on your configuration.

3. **Check your package.json.** If you've installed Tailwind CSS but still get the error, check your `package.json` file to make sure it's listed under `dependencies` or `devDependencies`. 

4. **Reinstall your packages.** If none of the above work, you might need to delete your `node_modules` folder and `yarn.lock` file, then run `yarn install` to reinstall all your packages.

After you've done all this, try running `yarn dev:frontend` again. If there's still an error, there might be other issues at play. Let me know if you need further assistance!
